description: Donald Trump harshly criticized the United Nations this week for being ineffective and even questioned its existence. But it has a clearly-defined purpose.
title: Trump asks what is the UN's purpose? This is the answer

description: Canada has pledged $60 million to help Haiti fight its brazen gangs, with most of the funding contingent on the United Nations supporting an American plan to expand a police mission into a "gang-suppression force."
title: Canada pledges $60M for Haiti, with most cash contingent on UN approval of U.S. plan

description: New Brunswick's ombud says Restigouche Hospital Centre staff have been restraining and secluding psychiatric patients improperly.
title: Psychiatric patients assaulted while restrained, left soiled in seclusion, N.B. ombud says

description: The Montreal-born Hungarian English author is recognized for his novel, Flesh, which contends with desire, social class and masculinity.
title: Canadian writer David Szalay shortlisted for 2025 Booker Prize

description: The man accused of trying to assassinate U.S. President Donald Trump last year at his Florida golf course was found guilty on Tuesday.
title: Man found guilty of trying to assassinate Trump on his Florida golf course

description: Robot umpires are getting called up to the big leagues next season after Major League Baseball's 11-man competition committee on Tuesday approved use of the Automated Ball/Strike System in the major leagues in 2026.
title: MLB approves use of robot umpires, challenge system for balls and strikes for 2026 season

description: RCMP says Darius Macdougall was last seen walking with his family south of Crowsnest Pass, near Island Lake Provincial Recreation Area's campground.
title: Search for missing boy in southern Alberta enters 3rd day

description: Public Safety Minister Gary Anandasangaree holds a news conference in Ottawa to announce the next steps in the federal government's gun buyback program.
title: Government announces new details on gun buyback program

description: Canada's main stock index topped 30,000 for the first time as strength in the energy and base metal sectors helped it climb into record territory, while U.S. stock markets were mixed in late-morning trading on Tuesday.
title: S&P/TSX composite index reaches record high as energy and base metals sector soars

description: Israel will indefinitely close the only crossing between the Israeli-occupied West Bank and Jordan from Wednesday, days after reopening it following a shooting that killed two Israeli soldiers.
title: Israel to close West Bank crossing to Jordan indefinitely starting Wednesday

description: ABC's Jimmy Kimmel Live! is set to return to the air, with millions of people expected to watch to see how he addresses his nearly week-long suspension. But on Tuesday, station owner Nexstar joined Sinclair in saying it will not air Kimmel's show.
title: Nexstar joins Sinclair in saying it won't air Jimmy Kimmel Live!

description: A Burlington, Ont., mom found out on social media that her child might have been exposed to blood-borne infections at a local walk-in clinic after public health identified the use of unsterile needles over the span of more than six years.
title: Mother searches for answers after public health says unsterile needles were used at Ontario clinic

description: Potential U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Pete Buttigieg says he did not imagine a “moment like this” between Canada and the United States and "outrages" directed at Canada and the Canadian government do not reflect the will of the American
title: Potential presidential candidate says U.S.-Canada relations going through 'storm' provoked by Trump government

description: The former Mohawk Institute — the longest-running residential school in Canada — now named the Woodland Cultural Centre, is preparing to open to the public for the first time as a museum on Sept. 30, National Day for Truth and Reconciliation.
title: 'How in the world could this happen to children?' Former residential school in Ontario to open as museum

description: The White House press secretary said on Monday that Tom Homan "never took" $50,000 US in cash from an undercover agent, after a damning report emerged over the weekend. Homan himself was less specific in his denial of wrongdoing in an interview with Fox News on Monday night.
title: White House shifts explanation on Tom Homan, U.S. border czar accused of taking $50,000 in a paper bag

description: High-profile Egyptian British activist Alaa Abd el-Fattah was released on Tuesday, his family said, a day after President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi pardoned him and five other prisoners.
title: Egyptian British activist Alaa Abd el-Fattah released after presidential pardon

description: Israel's devastating war in Gaza is expected to take centre stage as the UN's gathering of world leaders gets into full gear Tuesday, but humanity's myriad conflicts will also be in the spotlight as nearly a week of speeches gets underway, highlighted by U.S. President Donald Trump's address.
title: U.S. President Donald Trump speaks at the United Nations

description: The French Creek Residents Association's battle highlights some of the challenges B.C.'s regional districts face in terms of self-governance and authority compared to incorporated municipalities.
title: B.C.'s 'most urbanized rural community' fights to become its own municipality

description: Dozens of Western nations called on Monday for the reopening of the medical corridor between Gaza and the Israeli-occupied West Bank, offering to provide financial aid and medical staff or equipment to treat Gaza's patients there.
title: Canada among Western nations calling for reopening of medical corridor between Gaza, West Bank

description: Explosive drones targeting a suspected gang leader killed at least eight children inside a slum in Haiti's capital and seriously wounded six others, relatives and activists told The Associated Press on Monday, as they blamed police for the attack.
title: 8 children killed in drone attack in gang-controlled Haitian neighbourhood

description: A skilled drone pilot flew two to three large unidentified drones over Copenhagen Airport on Monday night, shutting down the airspace for hours as the unknown perpetrator appeared to be showing off their capabilities over Scandinavia's largest airport, police said.
title: Drones over Copenhagen shut Denmark's largest airport to air traffic for hours

description: Canadian author Robert Munsch has made the decision to pursue medically assisted death. Plus a broader look at the state of MAID in Canada.
title: Robert Munsch's decision to die

description: After several delays, NordSpace is making another attempt to launch its test rocket from St. Lawrence, Newfoundland and Labrador.
title: Countdown is on as Nordspace hopes to launch Canada’s first-ever commercial rocket

description: On the National Day for Truth and Reconciliation this year, "Every Child Matters" flags won’t be on display at Dufferin-Peel Catholic schools after the board updated its flag protocol earlier this year, restricting what flags can be displayed.
title: A GTA school board banned Every Child Matters flags. Now, some families are speaking out
The new, steep price for this U.S. visa could be a blessing for Canadian tech

description: Canada's security and intelligence organizations face "significant challenges" detecting and responding to security threats because of legislative gaps and outdated resources limiting when and how they can access private messages, one of the country's intelligence watchdogs warns.
title: CSIS, RCMP face 'significant challenges' obtaining private data: Intelligence watchdog

description: Former PWHL goaltender Erica Howe has now completed active treatment for her cancer with no evidence of disease. Throughout the whole journey — from treatment plans to fundraising and everything in between — she leaned on lessons from her hockey career.
title: How ex-PWHLer Erica Howe's hockey experience helped her battle breast cancer

description: A federal government official has confirmed with CBC News that the now-closed Ontario theme park Marineland has filed paperwork seeking to export its remaining 30 belugas, and a Chinese theme park says it’s considering purchasing the whales.
title: Marineland asks federal government for permission to export remaining belugas

description: On invitation from Chief Gary Quisses, Ontario's ombudsman visited Neskantage First Nation and identified many issues beyond the boil-water advisory that the community has been under for three decades. "It's shocking to me that in Canada in 2025, people are living under those conditions," says Paul Dubé, who also called on the province and Ottawa to take action.
title: Ontario ombudsman calls out 'unacceptable' living conditions in Neskantaga First Nation

description: Quebec’s police watchdog will provide an update Tuesday morning about a deadly police intervention in Longueuil, Que., where a 15-year-old boy was shot and killed during the weekend.
title: Quebec police watchdog to provide update after fatal shooting of 15-year-old boy

description: A Canadian expert on Russian warfare says he believes a direct line can be drawn between Moscow's repeated testing of the airspace belonging to NATO allies in Eastern Europe and the Pentagon's recent, quietly announced plan to cut security assistance to the Baltic states.
title: Under the radar: The possible link between U.S. Baltic security cuts and airspace incursions

description: The Criterion Collection's Mobile Closet landed at the Toronto International Film Festival earlier this month. It drew massive crowds, and helped showcase how the video distribution company is helping shape the future of cinema.
title: Would you pay $100 for a movie? Criterion and the 'second golden age' of physical media

description: Police have issued a public safety warning about a high-profile sex offender that has been released from prison to live in Vancouver.
title: High-risk sex offender Randall Hopley will live in Vancouver, police warn
